intro: Stachys germanica var. garana, commonly known as German violet or violet grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features basal rosettes of heart-shaped, hairy leaves. The plant produces spikes of violet-blue flowers in late spring to early summer, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This plant is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
